intro: Lithocardium crispiflorum, commonly known as the wrinkled-flower lithocardium, is a rare and endemic species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, adding a striking contrast to its foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its arid habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lithocardium crispiflorum is considered a vulnerable species.
